docs.lead_paragraph: The fast-growing abuse of prescription drugs has reached maternity wards in hospitals across the country.

headline.seo: Prescription Drug Abuse Soars Among Pregnant Women
headline.main: Abuse of Opiates Soars in Pregnant Women
headline.print_headline: Abuse of Opiates Soars in Pregnant Women

docs.abstract: Study in The Journal of the American Medical Association highlights the fast-growing abuse of prescription drugs that has reached maternity wards in hospitals across the country; study finds that number of pregnant women addicted to opiate drugs, and the number of babies born experiencing withdrawal symptoms, has risen sharply over the last decade.
docs.snippet: The fast-growing abuse of prescription drugs has reached maternity wards in hospitals across the country.

keywords.value: Journal of the American Medical Assn
keywords.name: organizations

docs.lead_paragraph: Overuse of narcotics and addiction are an issue, but emergency physicians often lack the training and tools to effectively help patients complaining of tooth pain and seeking prescription painkillers.

headline.seo: Emergency Room Doctors, Dental Patients and Drugs
headline.main: E.R. Doctors Face Quandary on Painkillers
headline.print_headline: E.R. Doctors Face Dilemma On Painkillers

docs.abstract: Emergency department physicians often lack the training and tools to effectively help patients who come in complaining of tooth pain; ER doctors not only lack dental tools and training, but it is known that many such patients are using tooth pain as a ruse to get prescriptions for narcotic painkillers.
docs.snippet: Overuse of narcotics and addiction are an issue, but emergency physicians often lack the training and tools to effectively help patients complaining of tooth pain and seeking prescription painkillers.

docs.lead_paragraph: Two new books, one by a group of medical ethicists and another by the feminist critic Susan Gubar, offer searing accounts of confronting a lethal disease.

headline.main: Assumptions and Attitudes Don’t Survive Cancer
headline.print_headline: Assumptions and Attitudes Don’t Survive Cancer

docs.abstract: Dr Abigail Zuger reviews books Malignant: Medical Ethicists Confront Cancer, edited by Rebecca Dresser, and Memoir of a Debulked Woman: Enduring Ovarian Cancer by Susan Gubar.
docs.snippet: Two new books, one by a group of medical ethicists and another by the feminist critic Susan Gubar, offer searing accounts of confronting a lethal disease.

docs.lead_paragraph: Sudden cardiac death is far more prevalent among young athletes than previously believed, recent research has shown.

headline.seo: Heart Risk in Young Athletes Is Gaining Attention
headline.main: Heart Risk in Athletes Is Gaining Attention
headline.print_headline: Heart Risk In Athletes Is Gaining Attention

docs.snippet: Sudden cardiac death is far more prevalent among young athletes than previously believed, recent research has shown.
